area.key: Popular javascript framework for displaying interactivce maps from various sources including OpenStreetMap
Terratype tile server. Map the future
Access key required to access all services
Terratype Access Key can be retrieved from your account

As well as being a collaborative project to create a free editable map of the world, where OpenStreetMap is normally accessed via paid for Tile Servers ran by other groups. OpenStreetMap can also be used as a Tile Server, but is severely restricted to non-commercial limited fair usage rules
© OpenStreetMap, Tiles courtesy of Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team
Free nautical database adding nautical and tourism information relevant to sailors. Including beacons, bouys, ports, waypoints, repair shops and ship supplies. Based off Mapnik.
Topographic maps focussing on high contrast contour lines and hillshading. Familiar to Germans

The Thunderforest Platform is the 4th major revision of the systems that powers OpenCycleMap. With mapnik and postgis at its core, supported with mod_tile, squid, and a host of other components, it provides robust, fast, reliable and wonderful-looking maps. The Thunderforest Platform has enabled me to expand to easily host multiple map styles and serve millions of requests per month to clients all around the globe.
Api Key as defined in your Thunderforest acccount
Thunderforest API Key can be configured by signing into your Thunderforest account
China’s State Bureau of Surveying and Mapping (SBSM) official web mapping service
Google's Map offering in China, complying with Chinese state law regarding coordinates systems
Organisations or companies that delivers map based data compatible with Leaflet V1
Server that you will be requesting image tiles from that creates the visual map
Error: This tile server Doesn't support the current coordinate system. Either change your coordinate system or this tile server

LeafletV1 allows multiple map sources to be used at different map resolutions. So as you zoom in or out, the contents of the map can come from different servers. The reason to do this, is that many of the free servers only allow resolution upto a certain zoom level or a map source will only provide maps images at specific resolution and expect other sources to be used at other zoom levels. Feel free to add as many zoom levels as required, as the zoom control will try and only allow maps within the zoom range that is set
Minimum zoom that you wish this tile server to be used. 0 = showing the whole world, 24 = smallest detail. Each tile server has its own range of zooms it can serve
Maximum zoom that you wish this tile server to be used. If you wish for this tile server to serve for only one zoom level then set min and max zoom to the same value

Minimum zoom level for this tile server has to be bewteen {{vm().provider.tileServerById[store().provider.mapSources[$index].tileServer.id].minZoom}} and {{vm().provider.tileServerById[store().provider.mapSources[$index].tileServer.id].maxZoom}}

Maximum zoom level for this tile server has to be bewteen {{vm().provider.tileServerById[store().provider.mapSources[$index].tileServer.id].minZoom}} and {{vm().provider.tileServerById[store().provider.mapSources[$index].tileServer.id].maxZoom}}
The maximum zoom level is lower than the minimum zoom level

Tries to directly access a map tile, this isn't always guarenteed to work for all tile servers that require login / access keys. If no image is shown, there is a chance this tile server is down, the Terratype configuration is out-of-date or the zoom level you require is invalid
Reload this map with current configuration
Where do you want the zoom control buttons to be positioned on the map
Select the default location when displaying this map to a content editor
